Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2009 05:22PM bethaib wrote: The same was true of me. I could take Tamox during rads if I wanted, my onc deferred to my rad doc and she didn't care either way. My onc said some rads docs say no, some say it's ok. I didn't want to deal with not knowing which one was giving me side effects if I had developed any, and I wanted to give myself some time to deal with rads before dealing with Tamox. So I waited till I finished rads. I stopped rads on a Friday and started Tamox on Sunday. Like everything else about BC, it is your decision after the docs have weighed in. What are you comfortable with?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen B4 or after Rads concernedsis concernedsis

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 01:46PM bethaib wrote:  I had the wire for my lumpectomy as did Jen above. I wore a hospital gown over me, I had to be taken to a different floor to get the wire done, so yes, a gown fits over them. I kidded I felt like Madonna lol   I had my husband and sister waiting with me, so I spent my time talking to them. I don't believe cell phone use was permitted as I was in a holding area near the surgery room. But I am not sure what it would like for you. I would imagine you coulr read if you wanted. They would just keep the book with your clothes I would think. Not sure how much help this is... You should have been given a number you can call to contact someone with your questions? I know I called the biopsy place twice before mine. They were very nice, patient, and were happy to answer my questions.

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 01:28AM bethaib wrote: Sorry but I have to agree with seaotter, why trade one cancer for the possibility of another? Isn't that why we do eerything we do...to prevent breast cancer..skin cancer can be just as deadly.
Posts.Title: Tanning after Radiation Jeanne_D Jeanne_D

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 05:30PM bethaib wrote: I noticed a tiny bump in my radiated area shortly after rads finished. My rad doc said it is likely a tiny mole. Said the rads can cause them to show up and then they fade away to where they were before. So will have to see.... I am currently seeing a dermatologist for a mole on my face that is "new" Had tons of them for years, but this one has bleed and peeled. Took a section and had it biopsied. Benign thank goodness, but get any you are concerned about checked ASAP. Wouldn't you rather know there is nothing to worry about?

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 01:59PM bethaib wrote: I injured my back a year ago and although I am 150 lbs, I still had a horrible time with the hard table. I only had an xray once a week, and the rad tx prep/rads themselves were very short, so it was tolerable. I had prescription patches (lidocane) that seemed to work well for my back pain.   Maybe you could try something similar?

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2009 08:52PM bethaib wrote: I've read the same about the possibility of the Tamox interfering with the rads ability to deal with the cancer cells. And while there is controversy, and nothing seems to be definite over one way or the other, I thought I would wait till after rads, why take that chance? I also wanted to know what I was getting side effects from (if I got any from either of them).
Posts.Title: Taking tomaxifen while going through radiation bqswnnhn09 1Cathi

Posts.Content: May 25, 2009 09:48AM bethaib wrote: When my rad doctor was setting me up for rad tx she told me that I will probably have a slight shadow on any future xrays etc on the very outer edge of my lung due to the rads. She said they placed the rads to have the absolute least possible exposure to the lungs. We certainly don't breathe the same during every single treatment, I know they watch that as everyone is more nervous their first couple days. My rad doc said she would have adjusted my rads if my breathing continued as it was. So I would think it is feasible the rads could have something to do with what is going on with you now. Perhaps you should seek another opinion? Or maybe someone will answer that has dealt with this...
Posts.Title: lung issues after rads. rasquel Leah_S
